title: Combining @Separator and @BeanParam
body:
### Describe the bug

In a recent [PR](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/29735), `@org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.Separator` was changed so that it can be applied to fields as well as parameters, with the expressed intention of making it work within classes used as `@BeanParams`.

This does not work as expected. Given `@Separator(",")` and `foo,bar,baz` I get a list with a single element `foo,bar,baz` instead of a list with three elements `foo`, `bar`, `baz`

### Expected behavior

If a collection field in a class is annotated with `Separator`, and that class is used as a `@BeanParam` in a web service, the values should be present in the field as separate items in the collection. 

### Actual behavior

The collection field is a collection with a single item, containing the entire parameter string.

### How to Reproduce?

https://github.com/jesjos/quarkus-separator-bean-param-bug-repro

In the `feature/main` branch the same behavior is reproduced for the latest Quarkus 3.x snapshot
